MARCOS ATTACKING SASEAN in Australia, broke up the protest. Subsequent protests were launched by Filipino migrants and progressive groups in Melbourne, Australia from March 4 to March 6, in connection with Ferdinand Marcos Jr.'s ASEAN-Australia Special Summit and attending here. Under the leadership of the New Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan) -Australia, protests have created the ASEAN Summit and Marcos's activities.

JUSTICE IN BILAR 5 and victims of the AFP-PNP fascist. The youth and progressive organizations of Central Visayas gathered at the University of the Philippines (UP) -Cebu Ampitheater on March 3 to pay homage and honor Bilar 5, the five red fighters who were killed by state forces in B? . Meanwhile, UP Cebu youths launched a candle light protest on February 29.

On March 5, human rights groups protested at Camp Aguinaldo in Quezon City to condemn a series of cases of abduction, bombing and deliberate murder of activists, progressive and AFP-PNP activists, progressive and revolutionary.

Philippine Mining Act, Ibasura. Katribu, Nature PNE and other democratic groups launched a protest in front of the Department of Environment and Natural Resources on March 4 to call for the abolition of the Philippine Mining Act of 1995. In the 29-year existence of the law, it delivered unparalleled harm to the nature and communities of indigenous peoples and peasants.
